sentences.en: A majority of the electorate oppose the law.
sentences.cn: 大多数选民反对这项法规。

sentences.en: According to radio the British electorate are going to vote tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 据电台广播英国选民定于明天投票选举.

sentences.en: Gandhi was accused by some of trying to appease both factions of the electorate.
sentences.cn: 一些人指责甘地试图安抚两派选民。

sentences.en: His personal relationship with the electorate stands in good stead ( John Sears )
sentences.cn: 他与选民的个人关系是有很大帮助的 ( 约翰西尔斯 )

sentences.en: In the country the vast electorate was restless and adrift.
sentences.cn: 在国内,广大的选民浮躁不安,旁徨而无所适从.

sentences.en: Mr Walsh has a keen appreciation of the priorities of the electorate.
sentences.cn: 沃尔什先生深刻理解选民最为关注的事项。

sentences.en: Only 70% of the electorate voted in the last election.
sentences.cn: 在上次选举中，只有70%的选民参加了投票。

sentences.en: Politicians all too often pander to the envious tendencies among the electorate.
sentences.cn: 政客们常常会迎合选民的妒忌倾向.

sentences.en: Politicians normally avoid getting tangled up in anything to do with their electorate's savings.
sentences.cn: 政治家们通常都避免卷进任何与选民储蓄有关的事情里去。

sentences.en: The electorate became increasingly intolerant of instabilities when the actual rates transgressed those considered tolerable.
sentences.cn: 当实际税率超过可以容忍的限度时,选民们就会越发不能忍受经济的不稳定性.

sentences.en: The electorate is growing tired of his posturings.
sentences.cn: 选民对他的口是心非逐渐生厌.

sentences.en: The proposed increase in income tax proved deeply unpopular with the electorate.
sentences.cn: 增加所得税的建议令选民十分不满。

sentences.en: There is widespread apathy among the electorate.
They largely misread the mood of the electorate.
sentences.cn: 他们很大程度上误读了选民的意图。

sentences.en: They make up a huge hugely important slice of the electorate.
sentences.cn: 他们是选民的重要组成部分.

sentences.en: Two-thirds of the national electorate had the chance to vote in these elections.
sentences.cn: 全国选民的2/3有机会在这些选举中投票。

words.tran_cn: 被选的人；特殊阶层；上帝的选民

trans.tran_en: all the people in a country who have the right to vote
